title: WAF Rules
description: A firewall rule for a zone

links.title: List Rules
links.description: Search, sort, and filter rules within a package
links.curl:
curl -X GET "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/zones/023e105f4ecef8ad9ca31a8372d0c353/firewall/waf/packages/a25a9a7e9c00afc1fb2e0245519d725b/rules?description=SQL injection prevention for SELECT statements&mode=CHL&priority=5&group_id=de677e5818985db1285d0e80225f06e5&page=1&per_page=50&order=status&direction=desc&match=all" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json"

mode.description: The setting a rule has been overridden to

objects.title: Anomaly rule
objects.description: Anomaly scoring rules (if triggered) will contribute to an overall threat score that determines if a request is detected as malicious. Users can control the total scoring threshold via the 'sensitivity' of the package.

priority.description: The order in which the individual rule is executed within the related group

name.description: Name of the firewall rule group

group.description: The group in which the rule belongs

allowed_modes.description: Defines the available modes of how the rule interacts when it is triggered.

items.description: The mode that the traditional firewall rule uses when triggered.

mode.description: The mode that the traditional firewall rule uses when triggered.

default_mode.description: The default mode that a rule uses

objects.example:
{
  "id": "f939de3be84e66e757adcdcb87908023",
  "description": "SQL injection prevention for SELECT statements",
  "priority": 5,
  "group": {
    "id": "de677e5818985db1285d0e80225f06e5",
    "name": "Project Honey Pot"
  },
  "package_id": "a25a9a7e9c00afc1fb2e0245519d725b",
  "allowed_modes": [
    "default",
    "disable",
    "simulate",
    "block",
    "challenge"
  ],
  "mode": "block",
  "default_mode": "block"
}
objects.title: Traditional (deny) rule
objects.description: Traditional rules, if triggered, will cause the firewall to immediately act upon the request based on the configuration of the rule. A 'deny' rule will respond to the request based on the configuration (block, challenge, etc) and no other rule processing will occur.

priority.description: The order in which the individual rule is executed within the related group

name.description: Name of the firewall rule group

group.description: The group in which the rule belongs

allowed_modes.description: Defines the available modes of how the rule interacts when it is triggered.

items.description: Defines whether or not the white-list rule should be allowed when matching the request.

mode.description: Defines whether or not the white-list rule should be allowed when matching the request.

objects.title: Traditional (allow) rule
objects.description: Traditional rules, if triggered, will cause the firewall to immediately act upon the request based on the configuration of the rule. An 'allow' rule will immediately allow the request and no other rule processing will occur.
